data.title: Let's Do Things (1931)
data.meta_description: Zasu & Thelma go out with two idiots to a nightclub.
data.text:
The first screen outing for the double-act of ZaSu Pitts and Thelma Todd. Pitts & Todd have been called the female Laurel & Hardy, and there's some truth to that - one is quick tempered and bossy, the other meek and flustered. There are differences though - Pitts & Todd are certainly a lot smarter than their male analogues, and while Todd is just as likely to resort to violence as Oliver Hardy, her hapless pal is never the focus of her ire.

The story here is simple sitcom stuff: the girls go on a disasterous double-date with a blowhard osteopath and an overweight deadbeat more interested in the contents of ZaSu's larder than her heart. At 28 minutes, the film is a…

The first in the Zasu Pitts/Thelma Todd short runs just under thirty-minutes, which would be the only film in the series to try and expand to a three-reeler. The story is quite simple as Zasu's boyfriend asks that she set Thelma up on a blind date. The blind date turns out to be with an annoying orthopedic physician. The four go out to dinner where the doc becomes more annoying and soon enough Zasu has had a tad bit too much to drink.

Even if you didn't know going in that this was the first film in the series you'd probably guess that after viewing because there's really not too many good things going on and it's clear the Hal…
